Reported by [~jdevenny]

Suggestions:
Option 1:  Explain where to stop watching the page (what page?)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49056].
  {panel}

Problem: The calendar errors that render 
1. Dominate a _lot_ of visual space
2. Most of the time the end-user has _zero_ control to fix them (e.g. server down).

This is what it looks like today

[!https://s3.amazonaws.com/f.cl.ly/items/3g3t1c3I243R0I3L3n1U/Image%202015-02-26%20at%204.38.08%20pm.png|width=300! |http://cl.ly/image/0F0o1Y2L2c46]

Which I think is far too weighted heavily. It may look not too bad on the mycalendars view, but looks worse on the Dashboard or embedded on a page. 

A suggestion 
* If there is more than one event type on a calendar, but just JIRA files, render a exclamation mark (!) icon and sentence "Some events could not load. Learn more"m clicking on it gives you an inline dialog with the problems and what you can do about them.
fields.summary: Improve the user experience of calendar errors rendering
allow specific calendar to be visible to all users in Confluence
Outlook 365 should support subscribing to Team Calendars
Ability to see upcoming sprints that haven’t been started yet
I keep having to remove unwanted calendars from the Calendars view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49048].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it's not possible to restrict Team Calendar edit for a period of time.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to restrict Team Calendar edit for over a time period
h3. Use Case


_We are looking for an option to utilize the Confluence calendar as a release calendar, where in the project teams can notify the concerned team that they want a release to be live on specified date/time._

_The problem is release team requires_ atleast _3-4 hrs preparations for a release to be made, so the project team should be permitted to set a time at least 4 hrs in advance. What we observe now they enter release event only 1 hr before._
fields.summary: Ability to restrict Team Calendar edit for over a time period

Add the ability to set start time of the day for team calendar
yearly view or expanded timeline view
Allow option in macro to let viewer select view
Administrative interface for changing user calendars
We should add a small calendar into the right panel of TeamCalendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49041].
  {panel}

Now event items have two different states, thanks to the filter condition(s):
- True: The event item matches the event filter condition(s).
- False: The event item didn't matches the event filter condition(s).

I think it would be nice to have multiple/custom event states and for each event state you got a specific filter condition, for example:
- Visible, filter: (JQL) project=Team AND status=Open
- Half-visible, filter: (JQL) project=Team AND status=Review
- Invisible, filter: (JQL) project=Team AND status=Closed
fields.summary: Event item states and specific filters for those states

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49038].
  {panel}

A (default) calendar where all users/groups are added programmatically, you won't have to add a new user or group manually. You will have similar settings for this calendar as for an event with the a JIRA event type.

*Settings like:*
- Separated events by: (JQL/Filter) ex; Users of group..
- Event type: JIRA Issues, JIRA sprints..
- Event item filter: status!=Closed...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49027].
  {panel}

h3. Removing a calendar from the users view throws an error.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Subscribe to a calendar
 # Click on the calendar menu > Remove
 # Select "Remove calendar..."

h3. Expected Results
h3. The calendar is removed from your calendar view.
h3. Actual Results

The following error is displayed:

 

*Error(s) occurred.*
 * 404 - null for uri: [https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/preferences/subcalendars|https://theeagle.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/calendar-services/1.0/calendar/preferences/subcalendars]

h3. Workaround

Rollback to Team Calendars 5.3.11
 # Uninstall Team Calendars 5.3.14
 # Download Team Calendars [5.3.11|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.extra.team-calendars/version/2260]
 # Install Team Calendars 5.3.11 via [file upload|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload]
 (!) Please ensure you perform the proper backups of your Confluence instance and the proper testing on a development environment prior to making these changes in production.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49016].
  {panel}

In Confluence 4.3.7 there is a problem in IE 8 when timeline view is used in a page.

h3.Steps to reproduce
# Login to Confluence 4.3.7
# Create a new page
# Insert Team Calendar
# Click on the Team Calendar and click on Timeline then save the page like the screenshot attached below
!TimelineView.jpg|thumbnail!
# Start clicking next button as described in the screenshot below
!IE8TeamCalendar.jpg|thumbnail!

Current behaviour : button is stuck after several clicks
Expected behaviour : button should not be stucked

Take note I have tested this on Confluence 5.5.1 and this issue does not occur in IE8.
fields.summary: IE8 Next and previous button in timeline view is stucked after several presses

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49013].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce :
# Login to Confluence as administrator
# Install Team Calendar
# Click on Add Calendar
# Add a new event to the newly created calendar
# Fill in the mandatory fields and choose Daily from the Repeat drop down menu
# Click Ok to confirm adding the event

# Login to Confluence as a regular user
# Add the newly created calendar by the administrator previously
# Edit one of the recurring events and change the event name
# Now delete the event that have been edited
# You will be prompted with the following message :
!deleteEvent.jpg|thumbnail!
# Once deleted, all recurring events will be deleted as well.

Current behavior : No option to only delete 1 event, instead it will delete all events.
Expected behavior : The following dialog should appear to give you 3 options 
!deleteOptions.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: deleting recurring events deletes everything without giving any options

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49000].
  {panel}

When I create a calendar event, I get the option to set a reminder.

When I try to set a reminder, I see a lot of options and information. I don't want to go through all that right now so I cancel out of it, but it cancels my whole new event, losing all my changes.

It feels heavy and complex, and too different to how reminders are set in every calendar app I've seen. 

But most importantly, it unexpectedly loses my content without warning.
fields.summary: When creating a new calendar event, setting a reminder then cancelling loses your event

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Drag and drop of JIRA Issue Dates to another date to update its date is not working. 

Team Calendar Version: 5.3.8-D20151021T015515 

*Pre Condition*
# Create Project with some issues in it
# Ensure that user has Edit and Schedule Issue Permission

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# From Team Calendar, create a new calendar.
# Add a 'Jira Issue Dates' event and select project in pre-condition above
# Under Single Date, check 'Issue Due date' checkbox and click ok to add event
# From Calendar, view with Month and drag any jira issue to another date to change the due date

fields.summary: Unable to update Single Date field on Team Calendar using JIRA Issue Date event type
Is there a way to change the company's favicon on our actual Confluence 4.3 version? Thank you!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48992].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to replicate

# Install confluence 5.6.6, with latest team Calendar
# Create about 80 or more events in the same month
# Print it out the Firefox 40 default printer

h5. Expected Behavior
All event are printed out

h5. Actual Behavior
Only first 2 weeks's event are rendered in the printing
fields.summary: Not all event are rendered while printing from firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48988].
  {panel}

h3. After you add a JIRA event to a Team Calendar there is no Delete option as there is with other events

h3. Reproduced in Cloud, version 5.2.16-D20150624T084818
(Reported by customer on Server version)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a JIRA Event to a Team Calendar
# Click on the event, no delete option is there

h3. Expected Results: 
Delete option would be there as it is for a regular event

h3. Actual Results
No Delete option displayed

h3.Workaround
Remove the Event from the list of events on the right of the calendar as shown in the screen shot:  !TCremoveevent.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: No Delete option on JIRA Events after they are added to Team Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48984].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Users who use Team Calendars for the first time will see the tour bus guide. However, if license is expired, tour bus guide cannot appear and cause spinner spins forever.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Team Calendars into Confluence and add an expired license.
# Although license is expired but it's still valid. Start to visit My Calendar.

h3. Expected Result
My Calendar page should show license error message without other implicit errors.

h3. Actual Result
There are implicit errors in the javascript and spinner doesn't disappear. See the attachment.
fields.summary: Calendar Tour Bus cause javascript error if licence is expired

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48983].
  {panel}

After updating some plugins (and the universal plugin Manager plugin), the Team calendar wont start any more:
This add-on couldn't be loaded. It has one or more errors that prevent it from being enabled.

So i thougth, that an uninstall and a new install would resolve this.

Now my question:
When i reinstalling the team calender, will the calendar items still remain?
Or is everything (calendars, calender items, ...) lost?
Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: when i reinstalling the team calender, will the calendar items still remain?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48982].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Trying to subscribe to a calendar doesn't generate the necessary link (the field is blank)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create or go to an existing calendar
# Click the 3 dots after the name of the calendar on the right and select the "_Subscribe_" option

h3. Expected Results
A link should be generated and displayed in the field
h3. Actual Results
The field is blank
h3.Workaround
If possible, go to Team Calendars' Global Settings and select the "_Disable Private URLs_" check box then try to subscribe to it again.
fields.summary: Subscribe to calendar doesn't create link
Team Calendars and Mac Calendar does not integrate properly (Timezone)
Fix https://sdog.jira.com/browse/PIPE-168#

h3.Workaround
Upgrade instead, to TeamCal 4.4.5, followed by TeamCal 5.0.5, then TeamCal 5.2.16. Even though the said column is only introduced in TeamCal 5.0, a direct upgrade from TeamCal 4.2 to 5.0.5 will still throw the said error, for unknown reasons
fields.summary: Team Calendars direct upgrade from 4.x to 5.2.x throws SQLException Invalid column name 'USING_CUSTOM_EVENT_TYPE_ID'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48978].
  {panel}

So far, it's been a pretty bad experience trying to get this plugin working. Trying to create a Calendar now results in the following error:

There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library: Database: - name:Oracle - version:Oracle Database 11g Enterprise Edition Release 11.1.0.7.0 - 64bit Production With the Partitioning, OLAP, Data Mining and Real Application Testing options - minor version:1 - major version:11 Driver: - name:Oracle JDBC driver - version:11.1.0.7.0-Production java.sql.SQLException: An SQLException was provoked by the following failure: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 11

Since about version 4.2 we've not been able to create Calendars. This error message was not previously displayed, the Create Calendar dialog would remain after clicking the button, but the AJAX response was some similar status 500 error message. So at least displaying an error message is a step in the right direction.

I've tried doubling the Java heap space, as that was the only advice I could find to resolve ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

In production we reverted to Team Calendars 4.1.4, as this was the last known working version (we evaluated this version and it worked). Since we purchased the product, none of the more recent versions have been working for us so we're sticking with version 4.1.4 and monitoring the situation on our dev server.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-48925].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a user whose name contains double quote characters is an ORGANIZER of an event, when an export to ICS is done, the ORGANIZER line is both improperly quoted, and the wrong length for line folding. The quote gets converted to a HTML entity i.e. &quot; which contains the illegal character semi-colon, and additionally the line length is treated as if it still took up only one character, so it wraps after longer than 75 characters. Note that for unaffected lines Team Calendar also seems to be wrapping at 73 characters instead of 75, which while valid, is not necessary.

As per the [RFC 2445|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2445#section-4.8.4.3], a double quote character is actually illegal except for quoting other characters, but additionally a semi-colon is an illegal character for a parameter value unless it's contained in a quote or escaped. It's not possible to escape a double quote as part of the parameter value, which must be why it's converted into a HTML entity.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a calendar
# Create an event with an organizer whose name contains at least one double quote character
# Export the calendar

h3. Expected Results

A valid ICS file

h3. Actual Results

The file is not valid ICS.

h3.Workaround

Manually edit the ICS file, locating the lines containing &quot; and modify the CN to be quoted, then re-do the line folding such that the line does not exceed 75 octets.

For example the following invalid entry:

{noformat}
ORGANIZER;X-CONF-USERNAME=username;CN="User Name":mailto:username@exampl
 e.com
{noformat}

Can be converted to this valid entry:

{noformat}
ORGANIZER;X-CONF-USERNAME=username;CN=""User Name"":mailto:user
 name@example.com
{noformat}

Alternatively, if you avoid having any users with names containing a double quote character, then you will not encounter this issue.
fields.summary: Export to ICS is in an invalid format if a username contains a double quote
